Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments, including 1886,0401.909) of Chian, possibly early patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky red, mostly worn, below; exterior reserved; inscription on interior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), temenos (said to be)
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1886, 0401.909. The lack of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces of the sherd make it difficult to determine to what style it belongs. Early patterned chalices have no decoration on either side of the chalice walls.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0307) (phase 2)
